content.title: Scalene Triangle Anatomy
content.description: Anatomic region where thoracic outlet compression occurs

key_concepts.details: Anterior: anterior scalene muscle; Posterior: middle scalene; Inferior: first rib
Subclavian artery and brachial plexus pass through; subclavian vein passes anterior
Cervical rib, anomalous first rib, hypertrophied scalene, fibrous bands
First rib resection and scalenectomy address this anatomic space

content.clinical_significance: Understanding anatomy essential for TOS diagnosis and surgical planning
content.statement: Scalene Triangle Anatomy is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Rare-Syndromes that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Scalene Triangle Anatomy helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Scalene Triangle Anatomy include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Scalene Triangle Anatomy.
